text:
E William Free & Company, Inc.

NEWYORK LONDON

April 20, 1981

Ms. E. J. Klein
The American Tobacco Company
245 Park Avenue

New York, N.Y, #10167

Dear Ellen:

There is a decrease In the newspaper schedule covering Cariton.
Seattle Post Intelligencer has ceased publishing ads on the front
page. (Eff. 4/20/81)

Ner
Auta. PERIOD CURRENT AUTH, REVISED AUTH. DECREASE
1-93 4/81 $56,804.00 $54, Mls.00 $2,360.00

ips foaris; ,

Cay!

‘Ann De Franco

ADF/
ce: H. W. Bahrenburge™
Je J, Mellett
W. Degenhardt

B. Donohue

400 PARK AVENUE, NEW YORK 10022, PL 4-9696, TELEX: 710-581-4476

summary: E William Free & Company, Inc. has ceased publishing ads on the front page of the Seattle Post Intelligencer (Eff. 4/20/81) The American Tobacco Company has decreased its advertising coverage of Cariton. The company's ad revenue has fallen from $56,804.00 to $54, Mls. $2,360.000.
